channel.title: Limerick by Pranshu Gaba
channel.copyright: This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution-ShareAlike 4.0 International License.

item.title: The Nine Bollards with Faces
item.description:
There once were nine bollards with faces,
Who caught all passers-by’s gazes.
  Some had a frown;
  Some eyes were crossed out.
They did their best to keep cars in their places.

item.title: Two Monkeys on a Bicycle
item.description:
Two monkeys sat on a bicycle,
neither knew how to ride the cycle.
    They tried out a stunt
    but they really stunk,
’cause they could only ride a unicycle.

item.title: The Shopping Trolley in the Hall
item.description:
There lay a shopping trolley in the hall,
so far away from the shopping mall.
    It was utterly lost,
    its path uncrossed
with no one there to look at it at all.

item.title: Two Ants at the Lake
item.description:
Two red ants called Mary and Jake,
one fine day, they went to the lake.
    Mary had some coffee,
    and Jake ate a toffee,
but none of them found any cake.

item.title: The Cat Named Toad
item.description:
There once was a cat named Toad,
Who loved to take naps on the road.
    He was very displeased,
    When woken from sleep,
Yet he decided to let it go.

item.title: The Old Man on the Beach
item.description:
There once was an old man on the beach
Who loved to watch all the seagulls screech.
    He fed them some bread,
    Which made them all dead,
That poor sad old man on the beach.
